properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 9:41PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
Strong east-to-southeast winds will develop through Turnagain Arm
and the Matanuska Valley Monday night with winds expected to
approach 70 mph in Turnagain Arm and 60 mph around areas of the
Matanuska Valley. Warm temperatures with these winds will bring
the potential for rain and snow Monday night until the front moves
through the area Tuesday morning.

Cold air behind this front will turn precipitation to all snow
late Tuesday morning or early afternoon, and there is the
potential for significant snow rates and snow accumulations from
Anchorage through the Matanuska Valley. The biggest question is
whether the front stalls over the region or pushes farther
eastward. Temperatures should also remain in the lower to mid 30s
on Tuesday which will make it a heavy, wet snow.

Stay tuned to the latest forecasts by visiting weather.gov/afc.

NWSheadline: STRONG WINDS WITH WARM TEMPERATURES MONDAY NIGHT WILL GIVE WAY TO SNOW ON TUESDAY
